data.name: 0000 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Sorry about before. I didn't mean to cause so much confusion…

data.name: 0001 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Misleading? What was?

data.name: 0002 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: I caused a big misunderstanding when I was crying in the Computer Society room…

data.name: 0003 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Ah, that. Don't worry about it—it's all in the past.

data.name: 0004 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: But because of that, I made you angry and stuff…

data.name: 0005 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's not true. I was angry at the Computer Society—you were completely innocent, Mikuru.

data.name: 0006 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well, I guess they weren't exactly in the wrong either though.

data.name: 0007 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: After that, the thing with their data getting lost—I heard about the apology.

data.name: 0008 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Apology? From who?

data.name: 0009 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Kyon and Nagato…

data.name: 0010 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hold on, that's the first I've heard of that.

data.name: 0011 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm, you got angry because of me, and the socket—

data.name: 0012 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I don't need details, just tell me what happened next.

data.name: 0013 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Then… they lost their data, and I heard those two went to apologize.

data.name: 0014 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: And by "those two," you mean Kyon and Yuki?

data.name: 0015 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Yes. That's what I heard.

data.name: 0016 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Yuki doesn't seem like she'd do that voluntarily, so it must've been Kyon's idea…?

data.name: 0017 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Going to apologize without getting consent form the brigade chief is a problem!

data.name: 0018 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Kyon's going to need some severe scolding later.

data.name: 0019 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: N-no way. Kyon was just apologising for causing them trouble…

data.name: 0020 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You're wrong about that, Mikuru.

data.name: 0021 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Everything would've been fine if they'd just clearly told us we were misunderstanding.

data.name: 0022 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The Computer Society being misleading was also a problem, so both are in the wrong.

data.name: 0023 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: #P06I feel like we were the only ones in the wrong though…

data.name: 0024 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What, Mikuru?

data.name: 0025 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I can't hear you—you're speaking too quietly.

data.name: 0026 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: N-nothing!

data.name: 0027 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What was Kyon thinking, getting Yuki involved?

data.name: 0028 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well, whatever. We'll deal with all of this in our review meeting after the summer camp.

data.name: 0029 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: W-we're going to have a review meeting…?

data.name: 0030 (281.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Depends on how I feel at the time. For now, let's just meet up with Kyon and the others.

data.name: 0031 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: I hope I was able to buy you some time.

data.name: 0032 (281.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Do your best, Kyon.
